author: robwaugh1974
title: How to find out if scumbags have deleted you on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram
text:
Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg via Getty Images Being defriended is the ultimate cuss of the modern age – the modern equivalent of spitting in your face, or upending a bucket of faeces over your head. Theresa May to trigger Brexit next Wednesday And just like in previous eras, the correct response to this grievous insult is to find out who has done it to you, and start plotting a terrible revenge. But how do you find these scumbags? Simple (or at least it is on Twitter and Facebook) – just follow our guide. Twitter Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg via Getty Images It’s easy to find out who’s unfriended you on Twitter – go to sites such as StatusBrew , and endter your Twitter username and password. The site offers a dashboard which will alert you when someone unfollows you. Instagram It’s a bit trickier on Instagram at the moment – the site recently changed its policies on follower data, which mean that a lot of apps won’t actually tell you. StatusBrew claims to offer the service – but only as part of a $20 rolling monthly subscription. Facebook How to see if people have deleted you on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter
Credit: Who Deleted Me On Facebook Who Deleted Me will do the trick – it’s available as a browser extension for both Chrome and Firefox browsers, and instantly reveals a list of contacts who have unfriended you every time you log in to Facebook. It doesn’t work retrospectively – so you’ll only know which contacts have unfriended you after you install it – but also lets you know when friends have been ‘last seen’ on Facebook. That means you can keep track on people who really should have replied to that direct message you sent them.
